content.description:
Climb up a bolted line - pass 2 bolts just left of and overlap, and then clip a third before making a move up and right out onto the next face over. Clip another bolt, head up to a bulge above where a 5th bolt, and the anchor can be found several moves below the top of the crag.

This has fun climbing, but it is short. At least it's not manufactured....
content.location: This is in the center of the Overhanging Wall.

content.description: This is a high quality route on the largely ignored Overhung Wall below Sport Park. No chipping or Z-clipping here. This is the 3rd route from the left and climbs out the largest section of overhanging rock. Restful, vertical slab climbing leads to fantastic, jug climbing through the overhang and a crux at the lip (a kneebar is very useful). After pulling the lip, easier slabby climbing leads to the anchors.
content.location: This is just to the left of the dihedral that marks the right end of the main overhang.

content.description: This has a good bit of climbing on good rock, but the shallow slopers got the best of me in the heat a few times. Save this one for cooler temps. While there are a few 'hard' moves on this climb, there is really only one crux at the second to last bolt. There is a technical move near the first bolt, then the insecure crux.
content.location: This is the second from the rightmost sport climb on the Overhanging Wall.

content.description: Begin at the base of a left-facing corner, & traverse left above a small bulge past 1st & 2nd bolt.  Ascend a slab that steepens to vertical as you progress upwards. The crux liebacks up a tiny, right-facing edge or rib to a small roof & flake corner. Lieback up the right-facing flake corner. Reach a juggy, horizontal break & last bolt. Continue over a tiny bulge & up a vertical finish to a ledge & the anchor. The route has cleaned up significantly in recent years.
content.location:
Located just right of

Invisible Touch

, this is the rightmost route on the Overhang Wall.

content.description: Start this fun juggy route by climbing up a slabby corner below the overhanging wall above. Easy climbing over a small overlap deposits one at a rest below the crux overhang which is climbed on positive edges, horns, pockets and flakes. After pulling through this, easier, but thought provoking, slabby climbing leads to the anchors.
content.location: This is the second route from the left end of the under-appreciated Overhung Wall.
